title: Apply for or renew your passport if you're abroad or live outside the UK

details.description: You can apply for or renew a passport if you're abroad or while you're visiting the UK if you normally live abroad - the process is different depending on where you are
details.body:
If you’re eligible, you can apply for or renew a British passport if you’re abroad or while you’re visiting the UK if you normally live abroad.

If you’re abroad

Your passport will be processed by a regional processing centre. The fees and application process vary depending on where you are.

It usually takes around 4 weeks to renew a passport abroad, but if you’re applying for your first adult passport it will take longer. You might also have to attend an interview.

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office website has information about what you need to do.

Don’t book any travel until you’ve got your new passport.

If you need to travel urgently, contact your local British Embassy, High Commission or Consulate.

If you’re visiting the UK

To renew your passport, use the:

  • urgent renewal service if you’re in the UK for 3 weeks or less
  • standard renewal service if you’re in the UK for more than 3 weeks

To apply for a first adult passport, you must use the standard application process. This takes about 6 weeks - you may have to attend an interview.

Your passport can only be delivered to a UK address - don’t book any travel until you’ve got it.
